content:
Cooking a new dish can be a great way to mix things up and explore new flavors! I'd be happy to suggest some simple and healthy recipes for you to try out this weekend. Here are a few ideas:

**Recipe 1: Baked Salmon with Roasted Vegetables**

* 4 salmon fillets (6 oz each)
* 2 tbsp olive oil
* 1 tsp lemon zest
* 1 tsp chopped fresh parsley
* Salt and pepper to taste
* 1 large sweet potato, peeled and cubed
* 1 large zucchini, sliced
* 1 large red bell pepper, sliced

Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Place the salmon fillets on one half of the sheet, drizzle with olive oil, and season with lemon zest, parsley, salt, and pepper. Roast the sweet potato, zucchini, and red bell pepper on the other half of the sheet. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the salmon is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.

**Recipe 2: Quinoa and Black Bean Bowl with Roasted Vegetables**

* 1 cup quinoa, rinsed and drained
* 2 cups water or vegetable broth
* 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
* 1 large red onion, diced
* 2 cloves garlic, minced
* 1 large zucchini, sliced
* 1 large red bell pepper, sliced
* 1 tbsp olive oil
* Salt and pepper to taste
* Optional: avocado, salsa, shredded cheese, cilantro

Cook quinoa according to package instructions. In a large skillet, heat olive oil and sauté the onion and garlic until softened. Add the zucchini and red bell pepper and cook until tender. In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, black beans, and roasted vegetables. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add your desired toppings.

**Recipe 3: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breasts**

* 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
* 1 package frozen spinach, thawed and drained
* 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
* 1 clove garlic, minced
* 1 tsp olive oil
* Salt and pepper to taste

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). In a bowl, mix together spinach, feta cheese, and garlic. Lay the chicken breasts flat and make a horizontal incision to create a pocket. Stuff each breast with the spinach mixture and drizzle with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.

**Recipe 4: Lentil Soup**

* 1 cup dried green or brown lentils, rinsed and drained
* 4 cups vegetable broth
* 1 large onion, diced
* 2 cloves garlic, minced
* 1 large carrot, diced
* 1 large celery stalk, diced
* 1 can diced tomatoes
* 1 tsp dried thyme
* Salt and pepper to taste

In a large pot, sauté the onion, garlic, carrot, and celery in a little olive oil until softened. Add the lentils, vegetable broth, diced tomatoes, and thyme. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes or until the lentils are tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

These recipes are all relatively simple, healthy, and delicious. You can adjust the ingredients and spices to suit your taste preferences. Have fun cooking and experimenting this weekend!
